reviewText:
Initial ReviewIt's about as simple as tower defense games go, the sound quality actually sounds bad, you have to really try hard these days to make sounds sound low quality but this game wins at that, the whole setup feels like it was literally a copy and paste from mobile to the PC platform. The ESC button doesn't even open the options, everything in-game is gem based like it would be in a free to play mobile platform game where you would have to buy more gems to buy cool things and I'm not too thrilled with it +the resolution isn't that great. There is even a clear spelling issue in the gem shop in the game, this would be fine if this was an early access game but this isn't and they're expecting you to spend $2-$3 on this.

This is the perfect free to play game for your smartphone.
I recommend you pick this game up for $0.25 (that's 25 cents) or less.

How did they come up with the pricing for STEAM?
I'm guessing they got around and threw numbers in a hat and then randomly chose $2.99 for their free to play game.

I would have not recommended this sooner but apparently I don't have enough time in this free to play mobile port.
You need to have used this product for at least 5 minutes before posting a review for it (1 minutes on record)."

UpdateI did decide to go back and play and my review is still the same
date: the gameplay is pretty bad for a tower defense game
hoursPlayed: very few game modifiers besides normal and hard setting / there is a survival mode but again very simplistic
helpfulPercent: you have two different speed settings: slow and normal speed
votesHelpful: not a lot of content to play through
votesTotal: becomes a boring grind for no real advantage=no STEAM achievements
votesFunny: the upgrade system is about as basic as it gets and doesn't provide enough advancements for towers. This game is very simplistic
commentsCount:
cannot stress that enough and wouldn't recommend going out of your way to buy it. Pick it up in a bundle or for very cheap/free. Very basic game in-general and I think the initial trailer for the game illustrates that.

There is nothing exciting nor unique about this tower defense game.

Would not recommend."

reviewText:
Game Information
Goblin Defenders: Steel 'n' Wood, is a tower defense strategy game, developed and published by Alawar Entertainment.

First glance it looked like it was developed for mobile devices. My guess it was originally made for mobile devices before it was ported.

There's a second game for this series but unfortunately it's for mobile devices only.

Game Visuals
I want to mentioned that the visuals for this game is well done even it's simplistic.

There a couple of complaints about the user interface takes up plenty of space at the lower portion of the screen. The user interface vanishes when a defense tower is dragged onto the field. It reappears when the defense tower has been place.

There's a option available, dragging and zooming, to view the entire field. This feature is very handy and makes planning a bit easier.

Game Audio
I want to mentioned that the audio for this game is well done even it's simplistic and somewhat repetitive.

Gameplay
There are only two game difficulty modes to choose from which is Normal and Hard.

There are two game modes to choose from and they're Campaign and Survival. The campagin game mode features five different areas with two levels each. The survival game mode is where the player is being bombarded with waves after waves of enemies.

The defense towers can be upgraded to its' highest level but it does requires a bit of coins. The highest upgrade level must be purchased from the shop using gems. These upgrades doesn't come cheap after all.

There are various game achievements but they're only in game. Each of these  achievements has certain requirements before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous
There are total of six different trading cards. You only get the three of those cards from the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and it's Booster Pack Creator.

My final thoughts, this tower defense game, fairly easy for those who haven't played these types of game before. But for those who had played tower defense games before won't find it challenging enough. I would recommend this game but not at the full price value.

reviewText:
(05/10) - A refreshing Average

Yes, this game doesn´t offer anything new. It´s just the standard TD with few upgrades, few towers, few enemies and few mission. It´s mechanics work fine altough it might feel a bit clunky due to it´s controls.
It´s an average game.

Then why am i recommending it?
I really enjoyed myself in this game. The unlocks are quick to get (which makes this one of the few TD titles on Steam that are no mindless grindfest), it uses what i has (which isn´t that much) very well and it get´s really difficult in the end which most TDs here on Steam fail to do.
Sure it is utterly simplistic but you actually have to use your towers wisely as the enemytypes counter them perfectly. That fact alone let´s it surpass easily 80% of the TDs on Steam.

It might be an average game but it´s over really quickly which i saw as kind of a positive. I didn´t get bored by it, so if you´ve already played the good TDs here on Steam, you might want to give thisone a try...
voteText: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I just don't like it. At some point difficulty spikes to hell. A map can take up to 40 minutes and when I lose on 35th wave out of 40 waves, I just don't want to repeat that. Interface icons are too big and overlap with your turrets, so in certain cases they can't be upgraded. The view of the map is a bit too small. You can make a maze with your turrets, but flying enemies will fly over them and can spoil your plan on early waves = repeating a map. Directions for enemies are not clear enough at start = repeating a map. There are too many colours - everythings seems to sting your eyes and it can be hard to focus. There is a nice variety of enemies. Turrets are nice and have levels of upgrades (damage, reach, reload time). There is campaing and survival mode. I guess it's a decent game overall, but it's not my thing overall and one level put me off so much that I won't bother myself with this game anymore. I would give it thumbs sideways, but since it didn't entertain me enough I will give it thumbs down (you should fix it Valve). Not bad, but not good enough to recommend. Bye.

reviewText:
I'm fine with simple games. I'm ok with mobile ports. I'm not ok with mobile ports that frequently crash and have a few really silly typos like amd" instead of "and".


The game itself is the most lackluster of tower defense. Better alternatives can be found for free on almost any flash game site out there. Even at under £1 it doesn't feel worth it."

reviewText: If you like Tower Defense games I can recommend this as it feels a lot like Field Runners, Garden Defense, etc.   I do want to warn you though it feels like it was made for a tablet or phone.   It is often zoomed in and zooming out to see what you are doing can be a bit of a pain.   It is also easy to click on UI elements when you do not intend to.   I almost clicked NO that I didn't recommend it due to how angry the UI and controls would make me.   It isn't a bad game as long as you go in knowing what you are getting into.   I highly recommend the author fix this to run at higher resolutions so the entire play field can be on the screen without scrolling around and clicking on UI elements unintentionally.   On steam and PC you are not limited to tablet and phone resolutions... take advantage of that and this game will be better.

reviewText:
Short Tower Defence game. Campaign only 10 locations (Normal or Hard) + Survival mode.
Graphics only 1280x720 (windowed or fullscreen, looks blurred).
HD Remake and more maps would help, but it is as it is (I greet 4K UHD).


Despite that, I am satisfied, I was amused.
What is interesting, because TW games are not my favorite.
Thanks.

reviewText: It is a pretty straighforward Tower Defense game with a nice bit of charm. I found it fairly challenging, especially on hard. Many of the flying waves were just brutal. The level design was very nice in particular. I will play it again and highly recommend it in any steam library.

reviewText: This Game Is Good ! But I Think You Should Add More Levels To It And Expand The Shop Maybe

Product received for free

At first glance, I thought this game was going to be a generic tower defence game, and it is...but a pretty fun one at that.

Pros:
-Nice artstyle
-Later levels are less linear, you get to create the path of the enemies through the placement of towers.
-In game achievements
-It's a tower defence game
Cons:
-Only ten or so levels
-Huge difficuty spike
-lack of enemy variety
-Only about 2 hours  of content

If it's cheap, go pick it up if you're a fan off TD games
